verses.verse: These are the words<WH1697> which Moses<WH4872> spoke<WH1696> unto all Israel<WH3478> on this side<WH5676> Jordan<WH3383> in the wilderness<WH4057>, in the plain<WH6160> over against<WH4136> the Red<WH5489> sea<WH6290>, between Paran, and Tophel<WH8603>, and Laban<WH3837>, and Hazeroth<WH2698>, and Dizahab<WH1774>.
(There are eleven<WH259> days<WH3117>' journey from Horeb<WH2722> by the way<WH1870> of mountain<WH2022> Seir<WH8165> unto Kadesh<WH6947>–barnea.)

And it came to pass in the fortieth<WH705> year<WH8141>, in the eleventh<WH6249> month<WH2320>, on the first<WH259> day of the month<WH2320>, that Moses<WH4872> spoke<WH1696> unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, according unto all that the Lord<WH3068> had given him in commandment unto them<WH6680>;

After<WH310> he had slain<WH5221> Sihon<WH5511> the king<WH4428> of the Amorites<WH567>, which lived<WH3427> in Heshbon<WH2809>, and Og<WH5747> the king<WH4428> of Bashan<WH1316>, which lived<WH3427> at Astaroth<WH6252> in Edrei<WH154>:
On this side<WH5676> Jordan<WH3383>, in the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, began<WH2974> Moses<WH4872> to declare<WH874> this law<WH8451>, saying<WH559>,
The Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> spoke<WH1696> unto us in Horeb<WH2722>, saying<WH559>, You have lived<WH3427> long enough<WH7227> in this mountain<WH2022>:

Turn<WH6437>, and take your journey<WH5265>, and go<WH935> to the mountain<WH2022> of the Amorites<WH567>, and unto all the places near<WH7934> to it<WH6160>, in the plain, in the hills<WH2022>, and in the valley<WH8219>, and in the south<WH5045>, and by the sea<WH3220> side<WH2348>, to the land<WH776> of the Canaanites<WH3669>, and unto Lebanon<WH3844>, unto the great<WH1419> river<WH5104>, the river<WH5104> Euphrates<WH6578>.

Behold<WH7200>, I have set<WH5414> the land<WH776> before<WH6440> you<WH935>: go in and possess<WH3423> the land<WH776> which the Lord<WH3068> swore<WH7650> unto your fathers<WH1>, Abraham<WH85>, Isaac<WH3327>, and Jacob<WH3290>, to give<WH5414> unto them and to their seed<WH2233> after them<WH310>.
And I spoke<WH559> unto you at that time<WH6256>, saying<WH559>, I am not able<WH3201> to carry<WH5375> you myself alone<WH905>:
The Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> has multiplied<WH7235> you<WH3117>, and, behold, you are this day as the stars<WH3556> of heaven<WH8064> for multitude<WH7230>.
(The Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of your fathers<WH1> make you a thousand<WH505> times<WH6471> so many more as<WH3254> you are<WH1288>, and bless you<WH1696>, as he has promised you!)
How<WH349> can I myself alone carry<WH5375> your encumbrance<WH2960>, and your burden<WH4853>, and your strife<WH7379>?
Take<WH3051> wise<WH2450> men<WH582>, and understanding<WH995>, and known<WH3045> among your tribes<WH7626>, and I will make<WH7760> them rulers over you<WH7218>.
And you answered<WH6030> me<WH559>, and said, The thing<WH1697> which you have spoken<WH1696> is good<WH2896> for us to do<WH6213>.

So I took<WH3947> the chief<WH7218> of your tribes<WH7626>, wise<WH2450> men<WH582>, and known<WH3045>, and made<WH5414> them heads<WH7218> over you<WH8269>, captains over thousands<WH505>, and captains<WH8269> over hundreds<WH3967>, and captains<WH8269> over fifties<WH2572>, and captains<WH8269> over tens<WH6235>, and officers<WH7860> among your tribes<WH7626>.

And I commanded<WH6680> your judges<WH8199> at that time<WH6256>, saying<WH559>, Hear<WH8085> the cases between your brothers<WH251>, and judge<WH8199> righteously<WH6664> between every man<WH376> and his brother<WH251>, and the stranger that is with him<WH1616>.

You shall not respect<WH5234> persons<WH6440> in judgment<WH4941>; but you shall hear<WH8085> the small<WH6996> as well as the great<WH1419>; you shall not be afraid<WH1481> of the face<WH6440> of man<WH376>; for the judgment<WH4941> is God<WH430>'s: and the cause<WH1697> that is too hard<WH7185> for you<WH7126>, bring it unto me<WH8085>, and I will hear it.
And I commanded<WH6680> you at that time<WH6256> all the things<WH1697> which you should do<WH6213>.

And when we departed<WH5265> from Horeb<WH2722>, we went through<WH3212> all that great<WH1419> and terrible<WH3372> wilderness<WH4057>, which you saw<WH7200> by the way<WH1870> of the mountain<WH2022> of the Amorites<WH567>, as the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> commanded<WH6680> us<WH935>; and we came to Kadesh<WH6947>–barnea.
And I said<WH559> unto you<WH935>, You are come unto the mountain<WH2022> of the Amorites<WH567>, which the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> does give unto us<WH5414>.

Behold<WH7200>, the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> has set<WH5414> the land<WH776> before<WH6440> you<WH5927>: go up and possess<WH3423> it<WH3068>, as the Lord God<WH430> of your fathers<WH1> has said<WH1696> unto you<WH3372>; fear not<WH2865>, neither be discouraged.

And you came near<WH7126> unto me every one of you<WH559>, and said, We will send<WH7971> men<WH582> before<WH6440> us<WH2658>, and they shall search us out the land<WH776>, and bring<WH7725> us word<WH1697> again<WH7725> by what way<WH1870> we must go up<WH5927>, and into what cities<WH5892> we shall come<WH935>.
And the saying<WH1697> pleased me well<WH3190>: and I took<WH3947> twelve<WH8147> men<WH582> of you<WH259>, one of a tribe<WH376>:
And they turned<WH6437> and went up<WH5927> into the mountain<WH2022>, and came<WH935> unto the valley<WH5158> of Eshcol<WH812>, and searched it out<WH7270>.

And they took<WH3947> of the fruit<WH6529> of the land<WH776> in their hands<WH3027>, and brought it down<WH3381> unto us<WH7725>, and brought us word<WH1697> again<WH7725>, and said<WH559>, It is a good<WH2896> land<WH776> which the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> does give us<WH5414>.
Nevertheless you would<WH14> not go up<WH5927>, but rebelled<WH4784> against the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>:

And you murmured<WH7279> in your tents<WH168>, and said<WH559>, Because the Lord<WH3068> hated<WH8135> us<WH3318>, he has brought us forth out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, to deliver<WH5414> us into the hand<WH3027> of the Amorites<WH567>, to destroy us<WH8045>.

Where shall we go up<WH5927>? our brothers<WH251> have discouraged<WH4549> our heart<WH3824>, saying<WH559>, The people<WH5971> is greater<WH1419> and taller<WH7311> than we<WH5892>; the cities are great<WH1419> and walled up<WH1219> to heaven<WH8064>; and moreover we have seen<WH7200> the sons<WH1121> of the Anakims there<WH6062>.
Then I said<WH559> unto you<WH6206>, Dread not<WH3372>, neither be afraid of them.
The Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> which goes<WH1980> before<WH6440> you<WH3898>, he shall fight for you<WH6213>, according to all that he did for you in Egypt<WH4714> before your eyes<WH5869>;

And in the wilderness<WH4057>, where you have seen<WH7200> how that the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> bore<WH5375> you<WH376>, as a man does carry<WH5375> his son<WH1121>, in all the way<WH1870> that you went<WH1980>, until you came<WH935> into this place<WH4725>.
Yet in this thing<WH1697> you did not believe<WH539> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>,

Who went<WH1980> in the way<WH1870> before<WH6440> you<WH8446>, to search you out a place<WH4725> to pitch your tents<WH2583> in<WH784>, in fire by night<WH3915>, to show<WH7200> you by what way<WH1870> you should go<WH3212>, and in a cloud<WH6051> by day<WH3119>.
And the Lord<WH3068> heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of your words<WH1697>, and was angry<WH7107>, and swore<WH7650>, saying<WH559>,
Surely there shall not one<WH376> of these men<WH582> of this evil<WH7451> generation<WH1755> see<WH7200> that good<WH2896> land<WH776>, which I swore<WH7650> to give<WH5414> unto your fathers<WH1>,

Save<WH2108> Caleb<WH3612> the son<WH1121> of Jephunneh<WH3312>; he shall see<WH7200> it<WH5414>, and to him will I give the land<WH776> that<WH834> he has trodden upon<WH1869>, and to his sons<WH1121>, because he has wholly<WH4390> followed<WH310> the Lord<WH3068>.
Also the Lord<WH3068> was angry<WH599> with me for your sakes<WH1558>, saying<WH559>, You also shall not go<WH935> in there<WH8033>.

But Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, which stands<WH5975> before<WH6440> you<WH935>, he shall go in there<WH2388>: encourage him<WH3478>: for he shall cause Israel to inherit it<WH5157>.

Moreover your little ones<WH2945>, which you said<WH559> should be a prey<WH957>, and your sons<WH1121>, which in that day<WH3117> had no knowledge<WH3045> between good<WH2896> and evil<WH7451>, they shall go in<WH935> there<WH5414>, and unto them will I give it<WH3423>, and they shall possess it.
But as for you<WH6437>, turn, and take your journey<WH5265> into the wilderness<WH4057> by the way<WH1870> of the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>.

Then you answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto me<WH2398>, We have sinned against the Lord<WH3068>, we will go up<WH5927> and fight<WH3898>, according to all that the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> commanded<WH6680> us<WH2296>. And when you had put on every man<WH376> his weapons<WH3627> of war<WH4421>, you were ready<WH1951> to go up<WH5927> into the hill<WH2022>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me<WH559>, Say unto them<WH5927>, Go not up, neither fight<WH3898>; for I am not among<WH7130> you<WH5062>; lest you be struck before<WH6440> your enemies<WH341>.

So I spoke<WH1696> unto you<WH8085>; and you would not hear, but rebelled<WH4784> against the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068>, and went<WH5927> presumptuously<WH2102> up<WH5927> into the hill<WH2022>.

And the Amorites<WH567>, which lived<WH3427> in that mountain<WH2022>, came out<WH3318> against<WH7125> you<WH7291>, and chased you<WH1682>, as bees do<WH6213>, and destroyed<WH3807> you in Seir<WH8165>, even unto Hormah<WH2767>.
And you returned<WH7725> and wept<WH1058> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068>; but the Lord<WH3068> would not listen<WH8085> to your voice<WH6963>, nor give ear unto you<WH238>.
So you lived<WH3427> in Kadesh<WH6946> many<WH7227> days<WH3117>, according unto the days<WH3117> that you lived there<WH3427>.
